page.title: 20A LAND OWNER IN MIDMAR
page.content:
The owner of Corsindae Estate is one of the biggest land owners in this area, owning 700 acres.He lives at Corsindae House which dates back to 1470.Corsindae Farm employs five people, three on the farm and two at the house, also others who are employed from time to time as agricultural contractors.There are fewer people working on the land now because machines do the work.The estate contains several houses (6 tenanted) including Corsindae House which covers three acres.The farm owns a lot of livestock including cows, bulls, stots, spring calves, ewes and spring lambs.It has 150 acres of planted woodland.
This survey was completed by children in Primary VII of Mimar school in July, 1985.
